- Email Notification
 - Script Action" - see this quote in link below:

questions.question_text:
Identify the way(s) an application can respond to an Event generated by the gs.eventQueue() method.

a. Script Action
b. Scheduled Script Execution (Scheduled Job)
c. UI Policy
d. Email Notification
When troubleshooting and debugging notifications, where do you navigate to see if an email was sent m response to an event?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. System Logs > Emails

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B.

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C. Proof is here:
https://developer.servicenow.com/dev.do#!/learn/courses/tokyo/app_store_learnv2_scripting_tokyo_scripting_in_servicenow/app_store_learnv2_scripting_tokyo_server_side_scripting/app_store_learnv2_scripting_tokyo_script_includes

Selected Answer: C
execution performance is not based on script include but rather logic, query and when/where script is running

Selected Answer: C
C. b, c, and d

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C

questions.question_text:
What are the benefits of storing the majority of an Application’s server-side script logic in a Script Include?

a. This makes execution faster.
b. Only run when called from a script.
c. The script logic can be hidden when the Application is installed from the ServiceNow Store. d. For some changes to application logic there is only one place to make edits.

choices.A: Run a flow from a Catalog item
choices.D: Test a flow using the “Run as” feature
choices.B: Call a flow from another flow or subflow

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT a Flow Designer feature?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
You can't call a flow from another flow but you can call a Subflow from a flow. Create a Subflow and call from the main flow.

https://www.servicenow.com/community/itsm-forum/how-to-call-a-flow-from-another-flow-in-servicenow/td-p/2349397

You can:
Run a flow from a Catalog item

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/rome-servicenow-platform/page/administer/flow-designer/task/create-sc-flow.html

Add stages to a flow

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/rome-servicenow-platform/page/administer/flow-designer/task/add-stages.html

Test a flow using the "Run as" feature

https://www.servicenow.com/community/now-platform-forum/run-as-property-in-flow-designer/m-p/1142272

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/sandiego-application-development/page/administer/flow-designer/concept/flows.html

Selected Answer: D
B is incorrect because you can call flow from flow. See here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WVu8mZeHImo

Selected Answer: B
B. Call a flow from another flow or subflow
